page.title: 14BUILDINGS IN THE BERROW AREA
page.content: {DOMESTIC:}The sector is rich in half- timbered buildings, mainly 17th Century, but some much older, mostly modernised. There are a number of red brick houses of Georgian type and some built in the 19th and early 2Oth Century but few built since the 1939 war. {FARM BUILDINGS:}Combine the ancient with the modern, many barns rebuilt on ancient bases and at least one Cruck-beamed barn still standing, this at Holiday Farm. {PUBLIC BUILDINGS:}The Duke of York Inn- possibly a 17th Century Pilgrims' Inn; the School- built in 1846, now used as a Village Hall; Hollybush Church- a small simple stone-built towerless church; St. Faith's Church- part Norman, simple lines, unspoilt, stone and rubble masonry, impressive "embattled" tower and 14th Century oak porch.
